title: Credit Suisse Books $850 Million Charge Over U.S. Mortgage-Backed Securities
sub_head: Charge pushes Switzerland’s second-biggest bank into a loss, denting strong performance during the pandemic
body:
An $850 million legal charge will push Credit Suisse Group AG into a net loss in the fourth quarter, denting what had been a strong performance by the Swiss banking giant last year.
Credit Suisse added the litigation provisions related to residential mortgage-backed securities following a review it started in December. It said last month it might have to pay $680 million in a New York civil case over a security it marketed more than a decade ago, although it plans to appeal and said it had set aside $300 million for that legal action.
The new charges reflect the potential bill for that case, and for other legal action over similar securities issued before the 2008 financial crisis that proved toxic for investors.
The provisions add to a $450 million fourth-quarter charge announced by the bank in November to reflect changes at U.S. asset manager York Capital Management, in which it holds a 30% stake.
Shares in Credit Suisse, Switzerland’s second-biggest bank by assets under management, fell more than 3% in European trading Friday.
